feed.title: NewsTracker: boko haram
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Nigeria's army says it has rescued 178 people held captive by Boko Haram
entry.summary: Nigeria's airforce also said that it helped ground troops repel an attack by Boko Haram around the village of Bitta on the southern edge of the Sambisa forest reserve, a stronghold of the militant group.

entry.title: Nigeria: Review of soldiers condemned in Boko Haram war
Benin pledges 800 troops to anti-Boko Haram force
entry.summary:
Benin's president has vowed to contribute 800 troops to a regional force intended to combat the Nigeria-based Islamic extremist group Boko Haram.

"This is an opportunity for Benin to express solidary with countries on the front line against the Islamic sect, Boko Haram. This solidary will result in the sending of a contingent of 800 men from Benin's army," Boni Yayi said.

Boko Haram became an affiliate of the Islamic State group earlier this year.

entry.title: AP Interview: Nigerian leader says multination forces soon ready to fight Boko Haram
entry.summary: He said his government is open to freeing detained militants in exchange for the girls' freedom, but only if it finds credible Boko Haram leaders to negotiate with.

entry.title: Nigerian leader: Forces ready soon to take on Boko Haram
entry.summary: But he predicted that the multinational force could break the back of Boko Haram within 18 months.

entry.title: Suspected Boko Haram fighters kill 23 in attack on north Cameroon village, residents say
entry.summary: Nigeria-based Boko Haram, which this year became the West African franchise of the Islamic State group, has targeted northern Cameroon repeatedly in retaliation for the country's participation in a regional military effort against the extremists.

entry.title: Suspected Boko Haram fighters kill 23 in north Cameroon
Obama Endorses Nigerian Leader's Agenda For Defeating Boko Haram
Obama meets with Nigeria's Buhari on countering Boko Haram
entry.summary: WASHINGTON U.S. President Barack Obama met with Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari on Monday at the White House and said the two planned to discuss cooperating to counter the extremist group Boko Haram, among other topics.

entry.title: Boko Haram tops agenda for Nigerian leader meet with Obama
entry.summary: Nigerian soldiers have said they are outnumbered and outgunned by Boko Haram and often are sent into battle with no food and just 30 bullets each.

entry.title: Suicide bombs kill 64 in northeast Nigeria on Muslim holiday
entry.summary: The upsurge in attacks followed a directive to create more mayhem during Ramadan from the Islamic State group, to which Boko Haram has sworn allegiance.

entry.title: Explosions kill 14 in north Cameroon town near Nigeria
entry.summary: Didier Badjeck said Monday three Chadian soldiers were among those killed by the bombs planted by suspected Boko Haram fighters in Fotokol, a town on the border with Nigeria's Borno state, on Sunday.

entry.title: Nigeria sacks four military chiefs
entry.summary:
Nigeria's President Muhammadu Buhari has sacked his army, navy, air force and defence chiefs, a widely anticipated move as the former general has made crushing Boko Haram his top priority.

Since his inauguration in May, Buhari has moved Nigeria's defence command centre to Maiduguri, the birthplace of Boko Haram, and is setting up the headquarters for a multi-national joint taskforce in Chad's capital N'Djamena.

entry.title: Boko Haram attack in Nigeria leaves at least 10 dead
entry.summary: A local police official who spoke on condition he not be named because he wasn't authorized to talk to media said the victims were all shot when the large group of Boko Haram extremists stormed their village and fired at fleeing residents.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Buni Yadi in northern Nigerian: military sources
entry.summary:
DAMATURU, Nigeria Boko Haram militants attacked the northern Nigerian town of Buni Yadi in Yobe state late on Thursday and it was unclear how the fighting had ended, military sources said.

"Those boys (Boko Haram) came to Buni Yadi yesterday and attacked our people. They came in about nine Hilux (pick-up trucks) and opened fire... Our people have mobilized for reinforcement," one the sources said.

entry.title: Boko Haram Offers to Release Chibok Girls If Leaders Freed
entry.summary: Shekau had threatened in 2013 to kidnap women and girls if Nigeria's military did not release detained Boko Haram wives and children.

entry.title: Activist: Boko Haram offering swap for captive girls
entry.summary: The new initiative reopens an offer made last year to the government of former President Goodluck Jonathan to release the 219 students in exchange for 16 Boko Haram detainees, the activist said.

entry.title: Bomb blamed on Boko Haram kills 20 in northern Nigeria
entry.summary: Nigeria's police force announced heightened security around mosques and churches after Boko Haram assaults Sunday killed more than 60 people.

entry.title: Bomb blamed on Boko Haram kills 20 in northern Nigeria
entry.summary: Boko Haram wants to install an Islamic state across the West African nation of about 170 million people divided between a predominantly Muslim north and Christian south.

entry.title: At Least 20 Killed in Suspected Boko Haram Bombing
entry.summary: Boko Haram may be responding to an Islamic State group order for more mayhem during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.

entry.title: Nigerian military frees 180 Boko Haram suspects, some babies
entry.summary: Others said they were arrested because their brothers were suspected Boko Haram members.

entry.title: Nigerian military frees 180 Boko Haram suspects, some babies
Bombs blamed on Boko Haram kill 44 in Nigeria
Boko Haram continue bloody Ramadan rampage in Nigeria
entry.summary:
Boko Haram militants slit the throats of 11 alleged "traitors," witnesses said in the first news of desertions from the Nigerian Islamic extremist group.

It is the fifth attack in a week that left 173 people killed as Boko Haram Islamic extremists appear to obey an Islamic State group order to step up attacks in the holy month of Ramadan.
